definitions.definition: a pole or rod that forms the handle of a tool or weapon:
examples: the shaft of a golf club

definitions.definition: a rod forming part of a machine such as an engine, that turns in order to pass power on to the machine:
examples: the drive shaft of a car

definitions.definition: the part of the hair above the scalp
a long structure like a stem in the body

examples: A shaft of (sun)light came through the open door.

definitions.definition: to cheat or trick someone, or to treat someone unfairly:
examples: She was shafted by her agent over the film rights to her book.
